title: 111_s3189
content: Expansion of transit operating assistance grant program. Expansion of transit operating assistance grant program. Section 5307(b) of title 49, United States Code, is amended to include different population thresholds for public transportation areas based on the number of buses in fixed-route service during peak hours. The transit operating assistance grant program is expanded to include different population thresholds based on the number of buses in fixed-route service during peak hours. The thresholds range from 600,000 to 1,000,000 depending on the bus count. The state or regional authority must operate at least 100 buses in fixed-route service during peak hours for public transportation. Designated recipients are limited in the use of funds, with restrictions on specific activities. Designated recipients are limited in the use of funds, with restrictions on specific activities such as not exceeding certain percentages for activities described in paragraphs (2)(D)(iii) to (2)(D)(vii). For fiscal years 2010 through 2015, designated recipients in urbanized areas with a population of at least 200,000 can use a percentage of funds for operating costs of equipment and facilities for public transportation. For fiscal years 2010 through 2015, designated recipients in urbanized areas with a population of at least 200,000 can receive a TIGGER grant for operating costs of equipment and facilities for public transportation. The grant amount is limited to a percentage increase from the previous fiscal year. Designated recipients in urbanized areas with a population of 200,000 or more can receive a grant under the Transit Investments for Greenhouse Gas and Energy Reduction program if they demonstrate total energy savings. The Transit Investments for Greenhouse Gas and Energy Reduction program offers grants to urbanized areas with a population of 200,000 or more for projects that result in at least a 10% energy savings or greenhouse gas emission reduction. The Secretary must allocate at least 10% of the funds for grants under the Transit Investments for Greenhouse Gas and Energy Reduction program, resulting in emission reduction of not less than 10%.
